Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PL-29 (Synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, Phe-rich, XXE, XXA, XXD15, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution,  peptide hybrid analog, designed

Literature.Author: Feng Q, Huang Y, Chen M, Li G, Chen Y. 2015
Literature.Reference: Eur J Clin Microbiol Infect Dis. 2015 Jan;34(1):197-204. doi: 10.1007/s10096-014-2219-3.PubMed
Literature.Title: Functional synergy of alpha-helical antimicrobial peptides and traditional antibiotics against Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria in vitro and in vivo.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (80%) toPL-18K: 40%, F: 27%, L: 20%, S: 13%.Chemical modification:  N-terminal acetylation (XXE) and C-terminal amidation (XXA).Activity: active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 2 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 2 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC 2 uM), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 1 uM), S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 1 uM), S. pneumoniae ATCC 49619 (MIC 2 uM).Synergy:antibiotics:  synergy with  imipenem.
